15#ifndef ISC_RESOURCE_H
16#define ISC_RESOURCE_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/resource.h */
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21#include <isc/types.h>
22
23#define ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED ((isc_resourcevalue_t)UINT64_MAX)
24
25ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
26
27isc_result_t
28isc_resource_setlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t value);
29/*%<
30 * Set the maximum limit for a system resource.
31 *
32 * Notes:
33 *\li If 'value' exceeds the maximum possible on the operating system,
34 * it is silently limited to that maximum -- or to "infinity", if
35 * the operating system has that concept. #ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED
36 * can be used to explicitly ask for the maximum.
37 *
38 * Requires:
39 *\li 'resource' is a valid member of the isc_resource_t enumeration.
40 *
41 * Returns:
42 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
43 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED 'resource' is not a type known by the OS.
44 *\li #ISC_R_NOPERM The calling process did not have adequate permission
45 * to change the resource limit.
46 */
47
48isc_result_t
49isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t *value);
50/*%<
51 * Get the maximum limit for a system resource.
52 *
53 * Notes:
54 *\li 'value' is set to the maximum limit.
55 *
56 *\li #ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED is the maximum value of isc_resourcevalue_t.
57 *
58 *\li On many (all?) Unix systems, RLIM_INFINITY is a valid value that is
59 * significantly less than #ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED, but which in practice
60 * behaves the same.
61 *
62 *\li The current ISC libdns configuration file parser assigns a value
63 * of UINT32_MAX for a size_spec of "unlimited" and ISC_UNIT32_MAX - 1
64 * for "default", the latter of which is supposed to represent "the
65 * limit that was in force when the server started". Since these are
66 * valid values in the middle of the range of isc_resourcevalue_t,
67 * there is the possibility for confusion over what exactly those
68 * particular values are supposed to represent in a particular context --
69 * discrete integral values or generalized concepts.
70 *
71 * Requires:
72 *\li 'resource' is a valid member of the isc_resource_t enumeration.
73 *
74 * Returns:
75 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
76 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED 'resource' is not a type known by the OS.
77 */
78
79isc_result_t
80isc_resource_getcurlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t *value);
81/*%<
82 * Same as isc_resource_getlimit(), but returns the current (soft) limit.
83 *
84 * Returns:
85 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
86 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED 'resource' is not a type known by the OS.
87 */
88
89ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
90
91#endif /* ISC_RESOURCE_H */
92
93
